Authors:
Philippe Cloutier, Christian Poitras, Denis Faubert, Annie
Bouchard, Mathieu Blanchette, Marie-Soleil Gauthier, Benoit
Coulombe
Title:
Upstream ORF-encoded ASDURF is a novel prefoldin-like subunit
of the PAQosome
Keywords:
ASDURF, PAQosome, R2TP/PFDL, prefoldin, uORF, small ORF
encoded peptide, BioID, AP-MS, chaperone, protein complex assembly
Abstract:
The PAQosome is an eleven-subunit chaperone involved in
the biogenesis of several human protein complexes. We show that ASDURF,
a recently discovered upstream open reading frame (uORF) in the 5Â’ UTR of
ASNSD1 mRNA, encodes the twelfth subunit of the PAQosome. ASDURF,
displays significant structural homology to beta-prefoldins and
assembles with the five known subunits of the prefoldin-like module of
the PAQosome to form a heterohexameric prefoldin-like complex. A model
of the PAQosome prefoldin-like module is presented. The data presented
here provides an example of a eukaryotic uORF-encoded polypeptide whose
function is not limited to cis-acting translational regulation of
downstream coding sequence and highlights the importance of including
alternative ORF products in proteomic studies.
